alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Juneau; Monroe; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 27 at 8:49AM CST until February 27 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Freezing Rain This Morning... .Freezing rain has spread northeastward through the region this morning. Slick road conditions have been observed for portions of southeast Minnesota thought western/north central Wisconsin. Several slide offs have been reported. Even with air temperatures slowly climbing above freezing throughout this morning, ground temperatures holding near freezing would lead to icy conditions to linger into the late morning. North of I-94, freezing conditions will persist into the afternoon, but an eventual change over to snow for areas north of highway 29 in north-central Wisconsin. Accumulations of 1 to 2 inches is anticipated by this evening. Temperatures will play a key role in icing amounts. Small changes could result in substantial shifts in impacts. Pay close attention to the forecast for any revisions. Roads that appear wet may actually be icy. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain, mostly along and north of interstate 94. Ice accumulations from a glaze to as much as 2 tenths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Buffalo, Trempealeau, Monroe, Juneau and Adams Counties. * WHEN...Until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions in some locations. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
